newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Bozano's net rises 131 pct in 1996 - paper.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Bozano's net rises 131 pct in 1996 - paper.

text.p: Brazilian investment bank Bozano, Simonsen ended 1996 with a net profit of 173 million reais, some 131 percent higher than the previous year, a local financial daily said.

Gazeta Mercantil quoted bank President Paulo Ferraz as saying revenues last year totalled 1.0 billion reais last year, of which 36 million reais stemmed from a contract to run Rio de Janeiro state bank Banerj.
Ferraz was quoted as saying the bank's good performance in 1996 resulted from a restructuring begun in 1993, when it began to focus its efforts on funds management and debt and credit negotiations.
The paper said the bank's net worth rose to 520 million reais last year, up 50 percent from 1995.
Total assets rose 54 percent to 5.5 billion reais last year while the portfolio of funds it administers reached 5.2 billion reais, up 62 percent from 1995, it said.
